ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. Give up trying to get child to do something
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 2. Lose your temper toward child
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 3. Punishment works
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 4. Child gets you to change punishment
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 5. Punishment triggers worse behavior
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 6. Child gets away with things
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 7. More trouble than it is worth
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 8. Spank child
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 9. Have difficulty controlling child
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 10. Decide not to punish child
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 11. Yell at child
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 12. Punishment triggers better behavior
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 13. Child gets around the rules
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 14. Child will do as you ask
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 15. Child accepts the punishment set
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 16. Threaten the child with punishment
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: 17. Will stop when asked
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: In the past six months, how often does your primary caregiver find time to listen to you when you want to talk to him/her?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Hardly ever; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Most of the time; 4 = Always; -7 = Refuse to answer

ElementDescription: In the past six months, how often do you and your primary caregiver do things together at home?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Hardly ever; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Most of the time; 4 = Always; -7 = Refuse to answer

ElementDescription: In the past six months, on weekdays, how often do you do something together with your primary caregiver like making something, playing a game, talking or going out together?
